correct_order: Over the years, I have had the opportunities to observe and understand the thought process behind the ads that have been flooding both the print and the TV.

Although there is a huge shift in the quality of ads that we come across on daily basis thanks essentially to improvement in technology 0 I somehow can’t help but feel that the quality of communication of the message has become diluted.
There is an increasing attempt by most companies to be seen as cool and funky.
Another reason could be the burgeoning number of companies, which means an exponential increase in the number of ads that are being made.
Proportionally, the numbers of ads that lack in quality have gone up exponentially as well

sources: There is an increasing attempt by most companies to be seen as cool and funky.
Proportionally, the numbers of ads that lack in quality have gone up exponentially as well

Although there is a huge shift in the quality of ads that we come across on daily basis thanks essentially to improvement in technology 0 I somehow can’t help but feel that the quality of communication of the message has become diluted.
Over the years, I have had the opportunities to observe and understand the thought process behind the ads that have been flooding both the print and the TV.
Another reason could be the burgeoning number of companies, which means an exponential increase in the number of ads that are being made.
